standardCivics.name: Criminal Heritage
standardCivics.description: This megacorporation can trace its origins back to a crime syndicate that eventually grew powerful enough to supplant all forms of local government.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Crime on Branch Office planets increases Branch Office value
Can build special crime-increasing Corporate holdings
Can build Branch offices on the planet of any regular empire they have no war or truce with

councilPosition.description: The Syndication Agency Officer ensures employees of external branch offices are properly trained in their field.

standardCivics.name: Franchising
standardCivics.description: This megacorporation relies heavily on franchising. Subsidiaries share a greater cut of their profits with their corporate overlord, in exchange for a license to market their goods under established brands.
effects: No Loyalty loss from multiple subjects
Cannot use Expansion Prohibited terms of agreement
Cannot use Limited Diplomacy terms of agreement

councilPosition.description: The Franchise Development Officer is responsible for expansion into new locations and markets.

standardCivics.name: Free Traders
standardCivics.description: The trading fleets of this megacorporation are bolstered by semi-independent free traders operating under license.

councilPosition.description: The Chief Trade Officer supervises trade with other empires.

standardCivics.name: Private Prospectors
standardCivics.description: Building better worlds is hazardous work, but this Megacorporation relies on private prospectors to chart and establish footholds on promising planets.

councilPosition.description: The Expansion Coordinator coordinates expansion efforts when claiming new systems.

standardCivics.name: Trading Posts
standardCivics.description: Good business is where you find it. This Megacorporation has a long tradition of spreading its influence through the establishment on trading posts. Their starbases are busy centers of trade.

councilPosition.description: The Trade Logistics Coordinator is in charge of coordinating trade route scheduling to optimize capacity.

standardCivics.name: Gospel of the Masses
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation embraces a curious blend of commercial and spiritualistic values, in which the position of ordained minister and corporate officer have merged into a single role.
effects: Can build Temple of Prosperity Corporate holding
+0.33 Trade value per free Spiritualist pop on empire or planets with Branch Offices

effectsPerLeaderSkillLevel: +5% Temple of Prosperity Ethics Shift Chance
councilPosition.description: The Executive High Priest is in charge of spreading the gospel.

standardCivics.name: Identured Assets
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation specializes in large indentured workforces. It has little to do with the barbaric practice of slavery - these workers are merely paying off their debts... indefinitely.

councilPosition.description: The Assets Appropriation Officer ensures efficiency in the trade of indentured assets.

standardCivics.name: Media Conglomerate
standardCivics.description: Before branching into other fields, this Megacorporation began its rise to fortune as a media conglomerate. Its PR department are still masters of spinning stories and presenting the latest quarterly report in the most advantageous way.

councilPosition.description: The Chief Marketing Officer runs promotional campaigns for the government.

standardCivics.name: Naval Contractors
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation relies on several semi-independent navy contractors to increase its fleet size. Competing for bids, the contractors are always struggling to outperform one another.

councilPosition.description: The Naval Procurement Officer negotiates contracts for the navy.

standardCivics.name: Private Military Companies
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation has a large number of powerful private military companies on its payroll. These mercenary contractors augment its ground forces.

councilPosition.description: The Public Security Chief maintains civilian order via private military organizations.

standardCivics.name: Ruthless Competition
standardCivics.description: All levels of society in this Megacorporation are constantly vying with each other in ruthless competition. It's a dog-eat-dog world.

councilPosition.description: The Chief of Staff thrives under pressure and will stop at nothing to prove their worth.

standardCivics.name: Catalytic Recyclers
standardCivics.description: This megacorporation seeks to maximize profits by recycling excess organic matter into advanced resources suitable for spacebound structures.
effects: Replaces Metallurgist jobs with Catalytic Technician jobs

councilPosition.description: The Chief Catalyst Officer oversees augmentation of catalytic raw materials.

standardCivics.name: Gigacorp
standardCivics.description: The ultimate goal of this empire is to ascend to ever greater levels of fulfillment.

councilPosition.description: The Chief Ascension Officer leads the pursuit of perfection.

standardCivics.name: Corporate Hedonism
standardCivics.description: Work is where you want to be. The citizens of this Megacorporation happily pledge allegiance - and all their free time - to their employers in exchange for lavish corporate comforts.
effects: Can use the Decadent Lifestyle living standard

councilPosition.description: The Chief Morale Officer ensures that extra benefits are available to those willing to pay.

standardCivics.name: Mastercraft Inc.
standardCivics.description: This megacorporation has focused its production pipeline solely on goods of the highest quality and profit margins, creating and marketing stunning products with artistry and craft.
effects: Replaces Artisan jobs with Artificer jobs
+1 Building slot per 3 industrial districts (except on Habitats)(+0.34 eacj)

councilPosition.description: The Master Crafter oversees craftsmanship in military applications.

standardCivics.name: Public Relations Specialists
standardCivics.description: If you can control what someone thinks, then you can also control their behavior. This Megacorporation has a virtual army of specialists ready to engage in battles of public opinion.

councilPosition.description: The Exopublic Relations Officer is responsible for improving our public image on the galactic stage.

standardCivics.name: Corporate Death Cult
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation has embraced ritual sacrifice as a means of ensuring its continuing profits. Willing initiates periodically give their lives in hopes of good fortune for their society.

councilPosition.description: The Chief Executive Executioner presides over sacrificial rituals.

standardCivics.name: Permanent Empoloyement
standardCivics.description: This Megacorporation has ensured that its employees will never be out of a job. Ever. After the employee's time is up, they will be repurposed for simpler tasks so that they can still provide for their families and pay off their debts.
effects: Can construct Posthumous Employment Center buildings
Pops created through organic pop assembly have the Zombie trait
Start with 3 or 4 pops with the Zombie trait
After 80-120 years, can gain the Zombie Contract Manipulation empire modifier
Defeated organic guardians can be resurrected

councilPosition.description: The Workforce Assignment Officer commissions and oversees new workers.

standardCivics.name: Trawiling Operations
standardCivics.description: Adept at utilizing nature's bounty, this society provides for itself a stable influx of sustenance and economic value.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Main species must have the Aquatic trait
No Agriculture district limit on Ocean Worlds
Replaces Farmer jobs with an Angler job on wet climates
Agriculture districts create Pearl Driver jobs on wet climates
-50 Agriculture district minerals cost on wet climates

councilPosition.description: The Chief Marine Officer is responsible for seaborne productivity.

standardCivics.name: Mutagenic Spas
standardCivics.description: This civilization engages in mutagenic bathing, with professional attendants overseeing the use of highly dangerous substances. This 'invigorating' process is marketed as a necessary step in wellbeing and personal development.

councilPosition.description: The Mutagenic Aesthetician promotes the importance and benefits of the bathing rituals.

standardCivics.name: Refurbishement Division
standardCivics.description: In this society, nothing goes to waste, even in the grimmest times of war: no enemy technology will go undiscovered, as teams of scrappers accompanying the war fleets scrape wreckages of anything and everything worth salvaging.
effects: Enables the Research & Salavage Debris debris policy
10% chance per ship debris to create a ship of equal size

councilPosition.description: The Master Scrapper is in charge of refining the salvaging process of scavenged ships.

standardCivics.name: Relentless Industrialists
standardCivics.description: To live is to exploit. This civilization is built around the principle of living life to the fullest, in the sense of squeezing the maximum profit from every last ounce of matter and membrane available for exploitation.
effects: Can construct Coordinated Fullfillment Center buildings
Start with a Coordinated Fullfillment Center building
First time a world is polluted triggers the Environmental Deterioration situation

councilPosition.description: The Chief Extraction Officer will exploit anyone and anything to ensure industrial expansion.

standardCivics.name: Privatized Exploration
standardCivics.description: For years, this civilization was told that the hyperdrive was almost finished. Patiently they waited, yet all the while, the subsidiary in charge of the project was quietly diverting the funds into their own, private accounts. When the fraud was finally revealed, the Corporation hastened to provide experimental, exploratory vessels.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
start with the Subspace Drive technology
start with a Resource Silo starbase building
Start with a second science ship
Certain starting technologies are not researched but available as permanent options

councilPosition.description: The Orbital Development Officer is in charge of constructing and maintaining orbital stations.

standardCivics.name: Pharma State
standardCivics.description: A strong nation is a healthy nation. This megacorporation maintains a robust economy through experimental drugs, highly privatized clinics, and aggressive marketing campaigns.
effects: Start with a Gene Clinics building
Start with the Genetic Healthcare technology
Start with the Subdermal Stimulatio technology as a permanent research option

councilPosition.description: The Pharmaceutical Executive is the representative for all healthcare corporations.

standardCivics.name: Precision Cogs
standardCivics.description: This megacorporation operates on a highly optimized and robust system of delegation. Such an approach means that a given task is always performed by the most qualified worker.

councilPosition.description: The Chief Posting Officer is responsible for the efficient handling of all delegation assignments.

standardCivics.name: Knowledge Mentorship
standardCivics.description: The knowledge, principles, and experiences of exceptional people are digitized and accumulated in the Vaults of Knowledge. Citizens can access this source of wisdom and experience to learn from the ghosts of the past. For a price, of course.
effects: Can construct Vaults of Knowledge buildings
Start with a Vault of Knowledge building

councilPosition.description: Dealers of Knowledge are responsible for maintaining the vast vault archives. They distribute the knowledge to those who are willing to pay for it.

standardCivics.name: Letter of Marquee
standardCivics.description: To combat space piracy and safeguard its borders, this megacorporation utilizes notorious pirates as military advisors and admirals for their fleets.
effects: Admirals have the MAterial Liberator trait
Can use the Pirate Raid casus belli

councilPosition.description: Acquisition officers are constantly headhunting for promising privateers and those with plundering experience who could expand our operations.
